intro: Helicteres pegueroi, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Helicteres pegueroi is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
